result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey E. KLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes transfer to Sheboygan County Jail and release for medical appointments.
Defendant is ordered to submit to DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge of possess THC - 2nd offense.  Convicted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for five (5) days, under the Huber Law, commencing 09-26-15 by 5:00 p.m.  Court authorizes transfer to Sheboygan County Jail and release for medical appointments.
Court costs are waived.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.
From Attorney Larson to Judge Rohrer dated 08-21-15.

Pretrial conference set for 08-19-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial set for 08-25-15 at 8:30 a.m., #2 position.
Letter from Attorney Larson requesting adjournment of trial.

Defendant requests a jury trial.  
Pre-trial conference set for 05-08-15 at 3:30 p.m.   
Jury trial set for 05-18-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Position No. 1. 
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 01-29-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-08-14 at 1:45 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 11-12-14 at 3:00 p.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-05-14 at 3:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.
